intro: Belmontia primuliflora, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with a fine, silky pubescence. Belmontia primuliflora thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
